material.mattext:
Males' height (X) follows (approximately) a normal distribution with mean of 69 inches and standard deviation 2.8. Using Minitab find: (a) What proportion of males are less than 65 inches tall? (What is P(X < 65)?) (b) What proportion of males are more than 75 inches tall? (What is P(X > 75)?) (c) What proportion of males are between 66 and 72 inches tall? (What is
P(66 < X < 72)?)

(a) Minitab provides: Normal with mean = 69 and standard deviation = 2.8 x P(X ≤ x) 65 0.0765637
So roughly 7.65% of males are less than 65 inches tall.
(b) Minitab provides: Normal with mean = 69 and standard deviation = 2.8
x P(X ≤ x) 75 0.983938
P(X > 75) = 1 − 0.983938 = 0.016062, and so roughly 1.6% of males are more than 75 inches tall. (c) Minitab provides:
Normal with mean = 69 and standard deviation = 2.8
x P(X ≤ x) 66 0.141988
x P(X ≤ x) 72 0.858012
and therefore P(66 < X < 72) = 0.858012 − 0.141988 = 0.716024 Roughly 71.6% of males are between 66 and 72 inches tall.
